newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil soybean areas to see only light rains - Somar.
newsitem.headline: Brazil soybean areas to see only light rains - Somar.

text.p: Brazil's key soybean growing regions will see only scattered light rains this week, independent meteorologist Somar said.
"Cold fronts will move rapidly across the extreme south of the country, causing only isolated showers in the soybean producing region," Somar said in a weekly report.
The southeast was expected to be rainiest with a forecast total rainfall of 15 mm.
In Mato Grosso, the weather was set to remain cloudy with showers and occasional thunderstorms. Temperatures were forecast to remain high due to a prevailing north wind.

In the past three days, the weather in the south has been cloudy with occasional showers and rains have been concentrated on the center and north of the country instead, mainly in Rio de Janeiro, Minas Gerais, Goias and Mato Grosso.
Rainfall in the past week and the historical monthly average in key states in millimeters were as follows.
TOTAL RAIN AVERAGE TOTAL RAIN AVERAGE
